oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crayon print of Lt. Benjamin B. Ferguson, Co. F, 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lt. Benjamin Ferguson was from Stoney Creek in Carter County and joined Co. F, 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA. Captured at Morristown, Tenn. on November 13, 1864, he lost his arm while in a Confederate prison camp in Richmond, Va. In this crayon print, Lt. Ferguson is shown wearing a non-regulation coat which may indicate this was done post-Civil War. According the regimental history, Ferguson was the first officer commissioned into the 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ferguson, Benjamin B.
